item.title: 特朗普贸易 "一个月后
item.description: 阿曼达-库珀（Amanda Cooper）对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Amanda Cooper.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+将在会议上推迟提高石油产量
item.description: 一位欧佩克+消息人士告诉路透社，欧佩克+将在周四晚些时候举行在线会议时推迟目前定于1月份开始的提高石油产量计划，以便为石油市场提供更多支持。【原文：OPEC+ will delay its plan to raise oil output, currently set to start in January, when it meets online later on Thursday, an OPEC+ source told Reuters, to provide additional support for the oil market.】

item.title: 华尔街创下收盘纪录新高后，期货市场停滞不前
item.description: 周四，美国股指期货走势平淡，在三大股指均创下上一交易日收盘历史新高后有所回调，市场关注本周更多与就业相关的数据。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were muted on Thursday, pulling back after all three major indexes posted all-time closing highs in the last session, with focus on more employment-related data this week.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，本田将因燃油泄漏问题召回超过 20.5 万辆美国 SUV
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，本田公司将因燃油泄漏问题在美国召回约 205760 辆 SUV。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday that Honda would recall about 205,760 SUVs in the United States over a fuel leak issue.】

item.title: 全球企业可能受到特朗普承诺的关税影响
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普在 11 月底承诺对美国的三大贸易伙伴--加拿大、墨西哥和中国--征收关税，详细说明了他将如何履行可能引发贸易战的竞选承诺。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump in late November pledged tariffs on the United States' three largest trading partners - Canada, Mexico and China - detailing how he will implement campaign promises that could trigger trade wars.】

item.title: 80 岁的联合国航空机构面临气候变化和交通流量增加的挑战
item.description: 联合国航空机构的一位高级官员告诉路透社，80 年前为现代航空旅行制定的全球蓝图本周面临着新的考验，即如何管理发展中国家的变化和不断增长的航空交通。【原文：A global blueprint for modern air travel struck 80 years ago this week faces fresh tests managing change and rising air traffic in the developing world, a senior official at the UN's aviation agency told Reuters.】

item.title: 纽约警方追捕杀害 UnitedHealth 高管的男子
item.description: 纽约警方周四正在搜捕一名男子，此人在曼哈顿中城一家酒店外的无耻袭击中枪杀了联合健康高管布莱恩-汤普森（Brian Thompson），最后有人看到他逃进了中央公园。【原文：New York police were searching on Thursday for the man who shot dead UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen attack outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel and was last seen fleeing into Central Park.】

item.title: 部长称苹果计划在印尼投资建厂
item.description: 印尼投资部长周四表示，科技巨头苹果公司计划在印尼投资一家生产智能手机和其他产品零部件的工厂。【原文：Tech giant Apple plans to invest in a manufacturing plant in Indonesia that produces components for smartphones and other products, Indonesia's investment minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，台积电正与英伟达洽谈在亚利桑那州生产人工智能芯片事宜
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士透露，台湾半导体制造股份有限公司正在与英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）商讨在该合约制造商位于亚利桑那州的新工厂生产其 Blackwell 人工智能芯片。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co is in discussions with Nvidia Corp to produce its Blackwell artificial intelligence chips at the contract manufacturer's new plant in Arizona, three sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 中国就对台军售对13家美国军工企业实施制裁
item.description: 在美国安排台湾总统过境中国后，中国外交部表示，针对美国向台湾出售武器一事，中国决定从周四起对13家美国军工企业实施制裁。【原文：China has decided to impose sanctions on 13 U.S. military firms from Thursday, in response to the sale of U.S. arms to Taiwan, the foreign ministry said after the United States arranged for Taiwan's president to transit through its territory.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油公司的谢钦说，"欧佩克+"减产使美国成为头号能源出口国
item.description: 俄罗斯最大的石油生产商俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）负责人伊戈尔-谢钦（Igor Sechin）周四表示，欧佩克+集团在2016年和2020年减少石油产量的决定有助于美国页岩产业的发展，并使其成为全球领先的能源出口国。【原文：Igor Sechin, the head of Russia's largest oil producer Rosneft , said on Thursday that the OPEC+ group's decisions to reduce oil output in 2016 and 2020 helped the U.S. shale industry and made it a leading global energy exporter.】

item.title: 土耳其反垄断机构结束对 Meta 公司共享线程数据的调查
item.description: 土耳其竞争委员会周四表示，已决定终止对 Meta Platforms 公司有关社交媒体平台 Threads 和 Instagram 之间数据共享的调查。【原文：Turkey's competition board said on Thursday that it has decided to terminate an investigation of Meta Platforms regarding data-sharing between social media platforms Threads and Instagram.】

item.title: 富士康称 11 月营收同比增长 3.47%，第四季度前景强劲
item.description: 全球最大的合约电子制造商、苹果公司最大的 iPhone 组装商台湾富士康周四公布，11 月份营收同比增长 3.47%，达到 6,726 亿新台币（约合 207.5 亿美元），创历史第二高。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn , the world's largest contract electronics maker and Apple's biggest iPhone assembler, reported on Thursday revenue for November rose 3.47% year-on-year to reach the second highest on record for the month at T$672.6 billion ($20.75 billion).】

item.title: 华为公司高管告诉国家媒体，华为 Mate 70 智能手机的需求 "过高
item.description: 一位高管周四告诉国有报纸《证券时报》，华为的供应链团队正在加班加点地工作，以满足新款 Mate 70 智能手机的需求，因为他们最初准备的货源不足。【原文：Huawei's supply chain team is working overtime to meet demand for its new Mate 70 smartphones as supplies they had initially prepared were insufficient, an executive told the state-owned Securities Times newspaper on Thursday.】

item.title: 世界经济论坛：商界领袖担心经济衰退和劳动力短缺
item.description: 世界经济论坛周四的一项调查显示，尽管有迹象表明经济状况有所改善，但全球商界领袖仍对经济衰退、劳动力短缺和通胀上升的风险忧心忡忡。【原文：Business leaders globally are worried about the risk of recession, labour shortages and rising inflation, despite some signs of improvement in economic conditions, a World Economic Forum survey said on Thursday.】

item.title: 瑞银称，受美国经济增长推动，全球亿万富豪财富跃升
item.description: 瑞士银行瑞银集团（UBS）周四表示，全球亿万富豪的财富在过去一年中增长了约 17%，这是因为美国超级富豪财富的大幅增长抵消了中国亿万富豪财富的减少。【原文：The wealth held by the world's billionaires jumped by about 17% over the past year, as significant gains among the super rich in the United States more than offset a decline in China, Swiss bank UBS said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国汽车制造商在欧洲转向混合动力汽车以应对电动汽车关税
item.description: 中国的汽车制造商正在加紧向欧洲出口混合动力汽车，并计划为这一重要市场推出更多车型，这暴露了欧盟电动汽车关税计划的局限性。【原文：Automakers in China are ramping up exports of hybrid vehicles to Europe and planning more models for the key market, exposing the limits of the European Union's electric vehicle tariff scheme.】

item.title: 11 月亚洲股市连续第二个月出现大量资金流出
item.description: 由于担心即将上台的唐纳德-特朗普政府明年可能对美国出口的地区产品加征关税，11月份亚洲股市连续第二个月受到外国投资者的抛售压力。【原文：Asian stocks were under selling pressure from foreign investors for a second consecutive month in November amid worries over potential U.S. tariff hikes on regional exports under the incoming Donald Trump administration next year.】

item.title: 早间竞价比特币的一劳永逸
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 马来西亚称美国对金砖国家征收关税可能影响半导体供应
item.description: 马来西亚周四表示，即将上任的特朗普政府如果试图对试图创造新货币或使用美元替代品的金砖国家征收关税，可能会导致全球半导体供应链中断。【原文：Malaysia said on Thursday any attempt by the incoming Trump administration to impose tariffs on BRICS countries for trying to create a new currency or use alternatives to the dollar could cause global semiconductor supply chain disruptions.】

item.title: 报告称特朗普执政期间油田服务整合将加剧
item.description: 根据德勤发布的《2025 年石油和天然气行业展望》，2025 年油田服务行业将进行更多整合，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普有望放松对美国石油和天然气行业的监管。【原文：The oilfield service sector is poised for more consolidation in 2025, according to Deloitte's 2025 Oil and Gas Industry Outlook, with President-elect Donald Trump expected loosen regulations on the U.S. oil and gas industry.】

item.title: 澳大利亚伍德赛德公司与 Bechtel 签订协议，开发路易斯安那州液化天然气项目
item.description: 澳大利亚伍德赛德能源集团（Woodside Energy Group）周四表示，该公司已与美国工程公司Bechtel签署了一份工程、采购和施工（EPC）合同，以开发路易斯安那液化天然气（LNG）项目。【原文：Australia's Woodside Energy Group said on Thursday it has signed an engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract with U.S. engineering firm Bechtel to develop the Louisiana liquefied natural gas (LNG) project.】

item.title: 专家们对比特币 100,000 美元里程碑的反应
item.description: "对于真正的信徒来说，这是一个巨大的里程碑，也可能是资产合法化的证据"。【原文："It's a massive milestone for the true believers and possibly evidence of the asset's legitimisation."】

item.title: 比特币突破 100,000 美元，因对特朗普加密货币计划持乐观态度
item.description: 自特朗普在大选中大获全胜以来，比特币今年的价值已经翻了一番多，在四周内上涨了约 45%。【原文：Bitcoin has more than doubled in value this year and is up about 45% in the four weeks since Trump's sweeping election victory, which also saw a slew of pro-crypto lawmakers being elected to Congress.】

item.title: 降息押注提振股市，比特币逼近 10 万美元
item.description: 在华尔街创下历史新高之后，周四亚洲股市涨跌不一，原因是美国服务业数据疲软增强了投资者对美联储降息的信心。【原文：Asian stocks were mixed on Thursday in the wake of record peaks on Wall Street as a softer read on U.S. services data boosted investor confidence in the Fed lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 欧元震荡，韩元持稳，政治动荡影响情绪
item.description: 周四，在普遍预期的法国政府垮台后，欧元走势低迷，激起了人们对该地区第二大经济强国的担忧。【原文：The euro was subdued on Thursday after the widely expected collapse of the French government, stoking worries about the region's second-biggest economic power, while the South Korean won steadied in the aftermath of the martial law debacle.】

item.title: 关注欧佩克+供应决定，油价上涨
item.description: 在当天晚些时候举行的欧佩克+会议之前，油价周四有所上涨，投资者在关注中东紧张局势的同时，也在等待产油国集团在削减供应方面的下一步行动。【原文：Oil prices rose on Thursday ahead of an OPEC+ meeting later in the day, with investors waiting to see what the producer group would do next on supply cuts while also monitoring tension in the Middle East.】

item.title: 日产老板内田为拯救汽车制造商和自己的工作而努力奋斗
item.description: 10 月初，日产汽车公司的经理们拨通了与老板内田诚的定期在线会议的电话，却听到了一个严峻的消息：业务比预期的要差，日本汽车制造商必须裁员减产。【原文：In early October, Nissan Motor managers dialed in for a regular online meeting with boss Makoto Uchida only to hear a grim message: business was worse than expected and the Japanese car maker had to cut jobs and production.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Synapse 倒闭后，FDIC 寻求直接监控金融科技公司
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美国联邦存款保险公司已开始直接监控全美与银行合作的金融科技公司。【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has started to directly monitor financial-technology companies that partner with banks across the U.S., Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国法院批准债权人协议后，巴西 Natura&Co 公司恢复雅芳交易研究
item.description: 巴西化妆品生产商 Natura&Co 公司在周三提交的一份证券文件中表示，该公司将再次开始权衡如何处理其在拉丁美洲以外的雅芳业务。【原文：Brazilian cosmetics maker Natura&Co will once again start to weigh what to do with its Avon business outside Latin America, it said in a securities filing on Wednesday.】
